The site-symmetry approach establishes the symmetry relations between the crystal extended states induced by localized states of some of the constituent structural units. The procedure for the determination of such a relationship is very useful, as it allows the prediction of the symmetry of the possible extended states starting from the crystal structural data. This task requires the derivation of the irreps of a space group
at any point in reciprocal space (which classify the extended states of the structure) induced by the irreps of the site-symmetry group of a Wyckoff position (according to which localized states are classified).
